We are currently recruiting for traders with 2-7 years’ experience. Trafigura is one of the largest physical commodities trading groups in the world. At the heart of global supply, Trafigura connects the world with the vital resources it needs. Through our Oil & Petroleum Products, Metals and Minerals, and Power and Renewables divisions, we deploy infrastructure, skills and a global network to move commodities from where they are plentiful to where they are needed most, forming strong relationships that make supply chains more efficient, secure and sustainable. With over 1,000 shareholders, Trafigura is owned by its employees and employs over 13,000 people working in 48 countries. Joining Trafigura’s trading team provides an unrivalled opportunity to build on experience and expertise in every part of the globe, while working with some of the best individuals and teams in the business. The role of a trader at Trafigura is broad, encompassing trading, shipping and storing physical cargoes, providing commercial input into investment plans, working in both physical and paper markets, using sophisticated risk management systems and techniques, while exploring new and innovative tools and technology. Expectations are very high with the opportunities to match. We are interested in hearing from people for this mid-level role with trading experience in any industry and field who are truly hungry to succeed and take the next step in their career. For the right people this is the opportunity to excel.

BIS Analyst APAC Stewardship Description About this role Description: As an independent, fiduciary asset manager, BlackRock is committed to acting at all times in the best long-term interests of our clients. We undertake our BIS activities to protect and enhance the economic value of the companies in which we invest on their behalf. The work of BlackRock's BIS team is an investment function. The team operates in six offices across three regions - the Americas (New York and San Francisco); Europe, Middle East and Africa (London); and Asia-Pacific (Tokyo, Hong Kong and Sydney) - and undertakes engagement with and proxy voting at portfolio companies on behalf of clients globally. BlackRock aims to take a common view in-house regarding our engagement and voting policies and uses the BIS group to coordinate, communicate and carry out these policies across the 95 markets and approximately 15,000 shareholder meetings at which the firm votes each year. Role description: This role is based either in Singapore or Hong Kong and reports to the Head of BIS Asia ex-Japan. The role is mostly dedicated to the coverage of the South Korea and India markets. The person is expected to provide support for the heads of APAC and Asia ex-Japan with regards to proxy voting and engagement with companies in these markets. This person will also work closely with the fundamental equities team to assist in the environment, social, and governance (ESG) analysis of investment targets. Responsibilities: Contribute to the team's core duty of proxy voting and company engagement in relation to companies in the APAC ex Japan Monitor the various corporate governance standards and best practices in the region and contribute to internal guidelines refreshment Engage with Institutional Client Business to ensure BIS reports, commentaries and RFPs are submitted on time and to an Job_Title: Manager, Credit Risk Management, Standard Chartered nexus
Job_Descriptions: Manager, Credit Risk Management, Standard Chartered nexus About nexus nexus is a white label plug-and-play banking solution powered by Standard Chartered Bank. We take pride in redefining how we bank customers globally by digitally marrying ecosystems to banks. Our Banking-as-a-Service (BaaS) solution is the gateway that enables convenient access to financial services. We believe in challenging the status quo and thinking outside the box to deliver innovative solutions. Let's shape the future of banking together. Nexus is looking for a high performer to support and work on additional lending products. You will develop credit risk policies and data analytics along with our experienced and highly collaborative risk team. What will you be doing: Assist the design and the development of data-driven risk strategies across end-to-end credit lending cycle, from underwriting (e.g. cutoff setting, indebtedness check, etc.) to portfolio management (e.g. limit management, exposure monitoring, etc.) and collections (e.g. contact strategy), using both traditional and alternative data points. Data analytics and/or data mining to facilitate the formulation of credit policies and risk strategies. Lead the implementation of credit strategies across decision systems/engines. Support the formulation of a robust credit reporting infrastructure to proactively monitor the lending portfolio and ensure performance meets defined KPIs. Assist and guide Product Owners across various streams on the tech development of risk controls and capabilities, as well as testing and defect resolution. Support critical activities for overall delivery such as onboarding of external vendors for credit/fraud use cases, formulation of financial P&L modelling, etc. Coordinate with internal stakeholders including Product, Technology, Legal, Compliance to enable smooth implementation of risk controls and capabilities alongside with product launch. Regular cadence with various stakeholders of credit risk management feature, strategy, and economics. What do you need to be successful in this role? You are equipped with strong analytical skills with high attention to details. You have hands-on experience in data analytics/science domain. You can communicate efficiently both in verbal and written manner. You are resilient and able to fail, learn and bounce back. You are hands-on in validating your assumptions and are able to rally stakeholders behind your ideas and execution plan. You are an agile, independent, proactive, and strong team player. You seek guidance when needed, are open to feedback and you challenge your colleagues. We are also looking for: Experience in retail / SME credit risk management, e xposure with digital lending landscape preferable. Proficiency in data analytics/science tools such as SAS, SAS Enterprise Miner, R, Python, etc. with proven experience in working with data. System knowledge at implementing risk strategies / models for lending products is a plus. Experience with Big Data and AI/ML algorithms is preferable. The nexus family is made up of a bunch of fun, hardworking and results-oriented individuals. Most importantly, nexaurs value teamwork, and we champion a respectful, open and trusting work environment. If you are interested to be part of the team in re-wiring the DNA of banking, join us today. #YesWeCanLAH Find out more about nexus and what we do at https://scventures.io/nexus/ About SC Ventures SC Ventures ("SCV") was established in 2018 with the purpose of "Rewiring the DNA in Banking" by bringing three distinct areas together: The eXellerator Lab, enabling innovation at large in the Bank by supporting intrapreneurs and their ideas, collaborating with fintech's through the SCV Fintech Bridge and engaging with clients and co-creation ideas. The Investment Fund ("Fund"), tasked to acquire minority stakes in fintech companies ("fintechs") whose technology has been successfully validated in the Group. Venture building, with the objective of exploring new business models ("ventures"), in the way it engages existing new customers and markets. There are c.65 team members (excluding individual ventures), including dedicated colleagues from the Group's support functions, based in Singapore, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Nairobi, London and San Francisco.

Job_Title: Head Strategic Initiatives, Cash Ops PDC
Job_Descriptions: Head Strategic Initiatives, Cash Ops PDC About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Responsible for the design, implementation and commercialization of capabilities and solutions relating to Strategic Initiatives, in partnership with Operations and Cash Product teams, to enable seamless front to back, client focused delivery and product capabilities capable of scaling globally across CCIB and CPBB client segments. Responsible to establish a lean operational 'Global model' for new platforms, to build digitized processes with nil/minimal manual touchpoints and support drive for 'standardization' in processes across countries in partnership with Global Functional Heads, by defining system and platform requirements, security access matrices, operational controls and deployment testing strategies. Play the role of lead Product Owner in Product Design & Control (PDC), to optimize utilization of investment budgets (c. $20M) for strategic platforms, and lead product and process design, creating, maintaining and prioritizing product backlogs with an outcome to streamline processes, enhance productivity, reduce risk and improve controls; and where required collaborate and partner with other non-Cash functions to enable an end-to-end digital service and delivery model. Strategic initiatives will cover all types of transactional flows relating to Cash products, including but not limited to replacing legacy applications and systems and alignment of new platforms to global standards (e.g. ISO, Wolfsberg recommendations on Payment Transparency). Partner with the Cash Product teams to support the commercialization potential of initiatives and solutions with a focus on the operational processes, i.e. higher cash revenues, increased liability balances and improved fee income. Define and develop the strategic direction and roadmap for Strategic Initiatives, aligned with Business Strategy and investment appetite, ensuring the Client Journey achieves delivery of the product backlog in line with the business strategy. Support the Global Functional head(s) in ensuring the client experience is seamless based on efficient processing, timely resolution of client exceptions and is perceived as an enabler by the business to generate and retain client flows, by establishing a monitoring mechanism (e.g. metrics) for reporting. Clear understanding of operational capacity and headroom for future growth, by partnering closely with Global Functional heads. Ensure local/regional process requirements and nuances from countries are incorporated into solutions and capabilities. Support teams across the team to leverage the new Ways of Working to experiment, innovate and iterate to deliver best in class solutions as part of the Client Journey construct. Strategy Responsible for leading Strategic Initiative function on Strategy, Operating Model, Risk and Controls standards and compliance with regulations, and ensure business processes are aligned with the organization's strategic goals. Track market and business developments from peer banks and fintech industry. Collaborate with Product and Technology on technological innovation and futuristic digital opportunities, pre-empt disruptive forces and commercialise innovative use of available and new technologies. Lead initiatives to innovate and digitize processes as well as driving collaboration and best practice sharing across the network. Business Support the Global Functional heads on the overall budget for the function and the delivery of the Business Efficiency targets. Drive continual experimentation within the Client Journey to deliver outcomes that align to the strategy and product backlog. Partner with the Business, taking product programs from Client Journey investment decisions, into design, specification, and solution phases, securing support services from other teams. The term "Product" is used here in a generic sense to describe required capabilities. It includes capabilities that are needed to meet regulatory requirements as well as capabilities for supporting "internal clients". Processes Responsible as an escalation point for operational or client issues into business and operations governance committee - identify remedial solutions and oversee timely, efficient implementation. Role model a strong, collaborative business relationship between Cash delivery teams across the global Strategic Initiatives function. Maintain strong lines of communication across our Cash footprint through an effective communication process. Regular review of business and performance metrics to ensure transparency to stakeholders and in line with the Client Journey plan. People and Talent Lead and support a change in mindset, building a culture of client centricity, agility, and accountability through standardised metrics and measurement, with the expectation that everyone in Strategic Initiatives Product Design & Control team are drivers and owners of client outcomes. Lead through example and build the appropriate culture and values. Set appropriate tone and expectations for the team and work in collaboration with risk and control partners. Employ, engage and retain high quality people such that the team is skilled and experienced to deliver its obligations. Ensure succession planning for critical roles. Ensure the provision of ongoing training and development, ensure that direct reports are suitably skilled and qualified for their roles and that they have effective supervision in place to mitigate any risks. Set and monitor job descriptions and objectives for direct reports and provide feedback and rewards in line with their performance against those responsibilities and objectives. Review team structure and capacity plans in accordance with change in business structure and demand. Governance Act quickly and decisively when any risk and control weakness become apparent and ensure they are addressed within an appropriate timeframe and escalated through the relevant committees in line with the banks policies. Partner with the relevant Sustainability Product Owner to ensure the Strategic Initiative teams are performing to an acceptable risk and control standard as per the defined Client Journey Sustainability framework. Work with the relevant the Risk team to own, develop and design control measures and monitoring plans for compliance and operational risk management. This is to be achieved, for example, by defining Key Control Indicators and Controls Standard Testing for product capabilities, ownership of the relevant Global Department Operating Instruction(s) and defining required security matrix, profile definition and access framework(s). Ensure that material risks that are brought to stakeholders' attention which affect business processes and critical systems and projects are monitored, managed (to minimise loss and risk), and escalated accordingly. Responsible as system owner for relevant applications aligned for the function. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Provide oversight across the Strategic Initiative function, ensuring compliance with the highest standards of regulatory and business conduct and compliance practices as defined by internal and external requirements. This includes compliance with local banking laws and anti-money laundering regulations and guidelines. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Through the Business Risk Managers monitor the effective communication and implementation of regulatory changes. Engage with local regulatory stakeholders and build trusted and valued relationships to drive outcomes that are satisfactory to the conduct of business in that relevant hub. Key Stakeholders Cash COO MT Cash Ops Global Functional Heads Cash Strategic Pillar Leads TB/Cash Universal Market/Country Leads TB/Cash Operations Leads Technology Heads/Delivery Partners Regional COOs and Regional Cash COOs Other Responsibilities Leverage the opportunity provided by Corporate Social Responsibility to enhance the Group's internal and external reputation and indirectly influence the bottom line. Promote the Group's brand and Here for good with employees, clients and regulators. Perform other responsibilities assigned under Group, Country, Business or Functional policies and procedures. Maintain effective communication with key stakeholders, including regulators and staff. Our Ideal Candidate Subject matter Expertise in Cash Management Operations / Products - primarily payments and collections Experience in Product Design and Control Experience in Change management and commercialization of product capabilities Knowledge of e-channels and client on-boarding Excellent communication skills Senior Stakeholder Management 10+ years of relevant experience Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. The Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering (SCELSE) invites applications for the position of Research Assistant. The provision of safe drinking water is of upmost national importance. Engineered water systems (such as drinking water distribution and HVAC systems) contain consortia of microorganisms and extracellular polymeric substances referred to as biofilms. Biofilms have been shown to harbor a broad variety of microorganisms associated with corrosion of the pipe material, lead to the breakdown of residual disinfectants like monochloramine, and are known to support the growth of opportunistic waterborne pathogens. In previous projects, an array of sensor nodes was established wirelessly in the drinking water distribution networks (DWDS) of two campuses in Singapore, measuring water quality and leak-detection associated parameters in real-time, and providing easy access to the network. More recently, a simulated Intermittent Water Distribution system and laboratory scale HVAC / chiller unit circles have been established and will be the foundation of in-depth research into the impact of hydraulic and physicochemical conditions on the formation of potentially hazardous biofilms and their microbial composition. We are looking for a self-driven, committed, and inquisitive Data Analyst to join our drinking water distribution team at SCELSE. In addition to the in-depth analysis and visualization of data obtained from the various operational and simulated water systems, the candidate will develop and validate molecular assays (generating positive and negative controls, designing, and calculating standard curves, determining recovery rates and inhibition factors) and microfluidic-based methods to detect bacterial indicator organisms. The candidate will also be involved in laboratory and field operations such as biofilm and bulk water sampling as well as housekeeping tasks such as ongoing quality control for the methods used. A wide array of novel techniques will be used (e.g., whole genome and 16S rRNA metabarcoding sequencing and microfluidic flow cytometry) and the candidate will get insights into their application in a public health-related critical infrastructure. Key Responsibilities: Planning, organizing, and conducting outdoor sampling of three well-established DWDS testbeds to understand the impact of operational events on drinking water quality. Analyzing water quality parameters Application of a wide array of novel molecular techniques and methods (e.g., next generation sequencing and high-sensitivity flow cytometry) for the analysis of samples collected in DWDS Validation and maintenance of quality control for current workflow based on advanced bioinformatical approaches Application of a wide variety of data analysis tools (e.g., R, Python and Graphpad) to gain insights into microbial communities in water and their relationships with physicochemical water quality parameters Interpretation and visualization of complex data sets Job Requirements: BSc in environmental engineering, data analysis or related disciplines. Advanced knowledge in collecting data, data processing and laboratory techniques. Basic understanding of biofilm biology, its relevance and detection methods. Experience in setting up and maintaining remote sensing equipment as well as experimental testbeds. An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving. Experience in flow cytometry. Experience in analyzing large datasets using R, working independently, and data modeling We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Hiring Institution: NTU

Psychology School of Social Sciences Nanyang Technological University, Singapore Young and research-intensive, Nanyang Technological University (NTU Singapore) is ranked 12th globally. It is also placed 1st among the world’s best young universities. The School of Social Sciences (SSS) offers undergraduate and graduate degree programmes in a full range of disciplines and actively promotes interdisciplinary learning and research. Tenure-Track Assistant Professors in Psychology The School of Social Sciences at NTU invites applications for a tenure-track Assistant Professorships in Psychology. Psychology is one of four major programmes in SSS, alongside Economics, Sociology and Public Policy and Global Affairs. The Programme attracts excellent students to its BSocSci, MA, and PhD degree programmes, and provides General Elective Courses for the entire University community. The Psychology programme is young, dynamic and research-active. We have a growing international reputation, and are currently ranked 27th in the world (QS Psychology Subject Rankings 2021). The successful applicant will be expected to join us in mid 2022 or as soon as possible thereafter. The successful candidate will hold a doctorate-level qualification in an appropriate Psychological field, be able to demonstrate effective teaching and training of undergraduate students, and have a strong track record of research commensurate with career stage (e.g., publications in peer-reviewed journals and conference presentations). Candidates with a strong publication record and specializations in one or more of these fields are particularly welcome: I/O Psychology, Personality Psychology, Health Psychology, Forensic Psychology, and Clinical Psychology. For Clinical Psychology, evidence of research and scholarly potential, and excellence in teaching and/or clinical supervision is highly desirable. The successful candidate will be expected to contribute significantly to teaching and development of multiple courses at the undergraduate and postgraduate level, including introductory level survey-type courses, laboratory and methods courses, and seminar courses. The candidate will also participate in the administration of the Programme, and develop an independent research career. Essential selection criteria: The attainment of a PhD/DPhil in Psychology or a related discipline A strong research track record, including publications in international peer reviewed journals Experience and interest in teaching undergraduate psychology students, with a strong and demonstrable commitment to the organization and delivery of teaching, particularly in one or more areas of I/O Psychology, Personality Psychology, Health Psychology, Forensic Psychology, and Clinical Psychology Excellent communication and interpersonal skills relevant to teaching and pastoral care Willingness and ability to contribute to the overall objectives of the Programme and School, and in working collaboratively with others Desirable selection criteria: Experience of academic administration Experience with securing grant funding Selection will be based on evidence of potential for high-quality research and effective teaching.  Relevant post-doctoral experience will be of significant advantage. For further information about the School, and Psychology, at NTU, please refer to the following website: https://www.ntu.edu.sg/sss/psychology Emoluments The Salary is competitive and will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. The University offers a comprehensive fringe benefit package. A p p li ca tion Procedure The closing date for applications is 28 February 2022. Applicants are invited to submit their applications (cover letter, CV, research and teaching statements, and citation report) through the NTU career portal by clicking the 'APPLY' button. Hiring Institution: NTU

As a Quantitative Analyst, you will be joining our Global Quantitative Analytics group (QA), which researches, develops and implements quantitative models for the FX options business. In your new role, you will be developing pricing and risk management models and analytics, providing quantitative analysis and advice regarding the usage of our models, working with IT on rolling out our models into strategic platforms, as well as developing relative value tools for FX structurers/ traders. Our Client is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. What will you be doing? Developing models and methodologies for pricing and Risk managing FX option products Developing the mathematical and financial foundation for new models and methodologies Developing tests, estimation and calibration procedures for the models and methodologies Writing documentation for the models and methodologies, including the estimation and calibration procedures Implementing the models and methodologies, as well as estimating and calibrating procedures in C++ and Python in Quantitative Analytics Libraries Monitoring the daily performance of the models and methodologies What we're looking for: Post-graduate qualification in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Quantitative Finance or another quantitative field Experience in a global financial services firm with relevant experience with option business modelling Experience of FICC option markets and modelling In-depth knowledge of C/C++ Skills that will help you in the role: Knowledge of additional languages, such as Python, C# and XSLT Specific experience of FX option markets derivatives Previous experience in C++ v11

Trading Solutions Chief Operating Officer Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking capabilities. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, we have a global reach with operations in about 50 countries and employ more than 45,000 people from over 150 different nations. Embodying entrepreneurial spirit, Credit Suisse delivers holistic financial solutions to our clients, including innovative products and specially tailored advice. Striving for quality and excellence in our work, we recognize and reward extraordinary performance among our employees, provide wide-ranging training and development opportunities, and benefit from a diverse range of perspectives to create value for our clients, shareholders and communities. We are Credit Suisse. We Offer Be a member of the Trading Solutions COO team for the Private Bank in Asia Pacific. The Trading Solutions COO team enables Trading Solutions teams in offering for Equities, Fixed Income, FX, as well as Structured Products and Derivatives thereof, including advisory, sales and execution services. You will focus on maintaining and further developing the best execution framework, processes and controls, as well as client order handling and management front to back across products. Seek to ensure that sophisticated solutions can be provided to PB APAC client facing employees and dealing desks in an efficient and effective manner. Build and maintain processes that improve client experience and regulatory compliance. Drive best-practice risk management. Build strong positive partnerships with executives within Trading Solutions and across the wider Investment Bank and Private Bank, as well as within key support functions including Technology, Compliance and Operations. Your future colleagues Trading Solutions COO is an integral part of the Private Bank's Product COO Organization, which supports product teams across investment, trading and wealth planning solutions. Product COO also owns Centers of Competence for Investment Suitability, Product Governance, Client Pricing, and more. Its comprehensive mandate ensures front-to-back alignment on the bank's top priorities, and it empowers individuals to assume far-reaching accountability. If your ambition is to build significant impact across product teams, relationship managers and clients, this role provides an outstanding platform. You Offer Yes Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

Job_Title: AVP, Fund Administration & Investor Relations Manager, Mezzanine Capital Unit (Private Equity & Special Opportunities)
Job_Descriptions: Job Description - AVP, Fund Administration & Investor Relations Manager, Mezzanine Capital Unit (Private Equity & Special Opportunities) (2200007M) OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world’s most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody’s. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World’s Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Department Description Mezzanine Capital Unit, a business unit within OCBC Bank’s Global Investment Banking division, offers comprehensive financing solutions involving debt-and-equity solutions to OCBC Bank’s existing and prospective clients in Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia and Greater China. We partner our investee companies in their business expansion and value creation plans by leveraging our extensive business network and deep industry knowledge. The Portfolio Administration team works closely with the various Investment teams to manage the end-to-end middle- and back-office functions. Summary of the Role The Fund Administration & Investor Relations Manager will manage the fund administration operations of the Lion-OCBC Fund and support new fundraising efforts and investor relations with existing and potential investors. The individual will have significant interaction with deal team members within the department, as well as other business partners, legal/compliance and corporate communications departments within the OCBC Group. This individual must have a high level of literacy with financials and the ability to absorb broad and complex themes and disseminate internally as concise and usable information. Key Responsibilities: Responsible for fund operations including coordinating the issuance of capital calls, organising Investment/Advisory Committee meetings, tax filing matters Liaise with fund administrator and auditor on bookkeeping and annual audit matters Assist with corporate secretariat matters relating to the investment vehicles, including the preparation of resolutions, updating of authorized signatories, renewal of power of attorney, opening of banking and securities accounts, etc Work with Portfolio Administration and deal teams on quarterly and annual earnings reports to external investors. Draft updates to investors; prepare pitch-books, private placement memoranda, and marketing materials Coordinate events and prepare investor presentations Maintain a database of due diligence information and coordinate due diligence process/ responses to investors’ queries Build internal relationships across OCBC Group and communicate with external investors and key industry stakeholders The ideal Candidate would meet the following requirements: Able to think logically, independently in a structured manner, strong problem-solving skills Highly detail-oriented, meticulous and well-organised Strong aptitude for numbers and comfortable handling large volumes of data Intellectually curious, keen to learn new things and able to comprehend broad and complex concepts Good interpersonal skills to engage internal and external stakeholders Good written and oral communication skills to articulate points clearly and succinctly Strong work ethic and self-driven Familiar with financial performance analysis, markets, and be a dependable source to external and internal stakeholders Good Excel, database and PowerPoint skills Good academic track record, preferably in Accounting & Finance Minimum 5 years working experience in fund administration, investor-facing roles in investment banking and/or private equity fund placement Ability to speak/read/write in Mandarin is preferred as the role is required to cover Greater China At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified. : Singapore : Capital Markets : Mezzanine Capital Unit : Permanent : Full-time : 24-Jan-2022, 3:13:24 PM

Product Development Manager Singapore Product Management and Development Asset Management Job Reference # 245695BR City Singapore Job Type Full Time Your role Are you passionate about the financial markets? Are you an innovator who loves to solve problems? We are looking for someone like that to: • Oversee all functions pertaining to the creation of new products with the overall goal of ensuring that the products are successfully designed, priced, positioned, launched, promoted and supported in a way that will generate sales and lead to increased and profitable assets under management for the Asia Pacific business • Ensure that the product shelf is fit for the future by maintaining an educated view on long term trends, setting a clear product strategy and driving product innovation - in terms of investment content, product format and product. Review and shape product features specifically including developing and shaping a superior value proposition to clients and respective commercial viability holistically, make proposals for improvement, drive decision making with relevant stakeholders and escalate where needed. Actively contribute to ESG-integration into Products’ activities and processes by supporting conversion plans and ensuring product shelf is aligned with UBS’ sustainability goals • Ensure product platforms remain relevant for existing and future product shelf by reviewing current product platforms to ensure infrastructure remains cost-efficient and appropriate for existing product shelf and supporting the establishment of new product platforms specifically Singapore VCC by collaborating with internal and external stakeholders to ensure platform readiness, working through internal approvals and identifying product solutions to support business needs • Contribute to operational excellence and simplification to increase efficiency and capacity by constantly seeking to enhance and improve day-to-day processes and embrace new innovations, assisting in the infrastructure build and digital capabilities to prepare fund platforms to support new distribution channels in the fund industry • Represent Products in Wealth Management Client Segment; regularly meet with Wealth Management client coverage team and where appropriate wealth management colleagues in APAC to identify product gaps, discuss new product ideas and manage existing products on the WM shelf • Analyse ideas for new investment strategies and potential products generated by the investment and distribution areas and provide supported opinions regarding success potential and overall positioning within the industry and the framework of existing UBS product strategies. In addition to crystallizing product ideas that are generated from other areas, the Product Manager is also expected to incubate ideas • Maintain existing products sponsored by Asia Pacific and resolve any post-launch issues; maintain communication with investments and distribution to ensure the continued viability of the products and to monitor the need for adjustments in current strategies • Stay abreast of the competitive landscape and industry trends in order to help the investment and sales areas position products properly in conjunction with their ongoing strategies; undertake fund-specific as well as firm-level competitive analyses to support marketing activities and overall product strategy formulation • Project manage local registrations of offshore UBS products in close coordination with distribution and local Legal and Compliance • Responsible for the on-going operation of Asia Pacific sponsored fund umbrellas Your Career Comeback We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback. Your team You will be based in Singapore, and work with product teams in Singapore, Hong Kong and the rest of Asia Pacific. UBS Asset Management, a business division of UBS, is a global large-scale asset manager with well-diversified businesses across regions, capabilities and distribution channels. With invested assets of US$1.2 trillion (as of 30 September 2021), we are a leading fund house in Europe, the largest mutual fund manager in Switzerland and the top foreign asset manager in China. We have around 3,400 employees located in 23 countries. Our main offices are in Chicago, Hong Kong, London, New York, Shanghai, Singapore, Sydney, Tokyo and Zurich. We offer a diverse range of investment capabilities and investment styles across all major traditional and alternative asset classes. These include equity, fixed income, currency, real estate, infrastructure private equity and hedge fund investment capabilities that can also be combined solutions and multi-asset strategies. UBS Asset Management is also focused on sustainable and impact investing and continue to expand our world-class capabilities in areas such as climate-aware solutions. Our Climate Aware assets under management has grown to more than USD 15 billion, while our wider sustainable-focused assets under management have reached over USD 97 billion. In addition, reflecting our commitment to support investor networks and drive the ESG agenda in financial markets, in 2020 we joined the “One Planet Asset Managers” initiative and became one of the founding members of the “Net Zero Asset Managers” initiative. Your expertise • A strong capital markets pedigree with experience in Asia Pacific financial industry, ideally supported by a background as portfolio manager, investment strategist, or product manager within an asset management business, investment bank, or other capital markets-related organization • Minimum 7 years of experience in Product Development and Management with strong focus on Asia wholesale and institutional business with multiple distribution partners • Knowledge across a broad spectrum of investment capabilities including equity, fixed income, multi-asset and alternative products • Familiar with the general legal and regulatory framework for Luxembourg, Ireland or Cayman fund vehicles (HK, Singapore and China domicile or other Asia domicile a plus) especially in HK, Singapore, China or other Asian countries helpful • needs to establish credibility with internal stakeholders quickly and sustainably. It is critical therefore that he or she is passionate about the markets and able to think like a portfolio manager, challenge the status quo, form opinions, as well as initiate stimulating discussions around market developments and what they mean for clients and the firm •needs to be able to communicate thought processes and build consensus, coupled with an independence of mind and pragmatism • will have a track record in working closely with senior stakeholders, be it in an advisory or a business development capacity, and have experienced the investment business throughout different cycles. The ideal candidate will understand the structures, decision-making and thought processes of different client segments and have a perspective on how first class client strategic thinking influences product and, ultimately, business development • Excellent proficiency in English and Mandarin (as you will be speaking to clients in the region, e.g. China) About us UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors. With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, at UBS we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact? Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. Job_Descriptions: Global Assistant Category Strategy & Innovation Manager, Skin Cleansing & Oral Care Job ID: R-28281 Category: Marketing Location: Singapore Date posted: 01/24/2022 JOB TITLE: Global Assistant Category Strategy & Innovation Manager, Skin Cleansing & Oral Care JOB LOCATION: SingaporeRELOCATION TERMS: Local terms This is an open job posting for Skin Cleansing & Oral Care Assistant Category Strategy & Innovation Manager, based in Singapore. The role will report to the Category Strategy Manager. What will this role do? This is a high visibility position, working with and learning from the EVP and other GCLT members– enabling excellent opportunity to build category fundamentals, develop strategic credence and leadership fundamentals. The Cat Strat team is the expression of the culture of the category, so strong personal mastery with passion for the driving culture is crucial. Strong interpersonal skills required to build and leverage relationships within the business. The role encompasses multiple different aspects and the incumbent needs to constantly juggle between assisting in developing strategic vision to operational development, strong governance aspects – requiring high level of agility, attention to detail and shift in mindset A great eye for detail, skill in assisting in creating strategic, busines documents, high degree of self-regulation and ability to see through trends and patterns are important skill sets. Assist in the development of long term innovation strategies for the entire category by looking at external trends and working with cross functions Assist in developing consumer centric innovations that tap into the latest market trends in D&E markets Must manage changing priorities and short turnaround times to meet weekly deadlines for big workstreams; be able to anticipate changes while meeting deadlines. What is the level of exposure & opportunity? Exposure to the entire category and ability to work on multiple brands, key market opportunities to make a big impact Great exposure within the business and chance to engage with all functions, markets and WLs Fun and energizing role, always working with people and never solo What are the Key Challenges? The role is in a team which requires delivering through others which is harder than delivering yourself! Need to be able to manage conflicting priorities and requests from multiple stakeholders – in different time zones, functions, and often with different priorities. Who can do this role? People who have worked in global or local marketing with a deep knowledge of Unilever’s ways of working in categories Having had experience in mix creation or P&L/business case development will be an added advantage TO APPLY Please apply online by clicking on “Apply” below. About us Being a pivotal role in the concept to production of a Dyson Designed Cell puts the Development team at the heart of this exciting journey. The Team will translate early concept directions into fully developed, optimised & validated solutions to make at high volume for the next generation of Dyson products.About the role Development of novel Cell technology comes with new and highly challenging manufacturing processes. You will join a team of technical specialists and work alongside these highly talented and creative individuals to fulfil our endeavors in researching and developing energy storage technologies.  To meet Dyson’s growing energy storage requirements, your focus will be the production of prototype cells and you will be involved in the end-to-end process from chemical processing and roll-to-roll coatings, through preparation of materials and components, to the hands-on assembly of prototype cells using a combination of manual and automated processes. Support small scale prototype builds of battery cells for testing and characterisation, enabling the development of our next generation processes, equipment and products. Responsible to arrange consumables, tools, jigs/fixtures etc. to support build, testing activities. Work with Engineer to perform periodic preventive and corrective maintenance such as cleaning equipment to ensure that equipment continues to perform reliably. Work with Engineer in developing and implementing SOP, test and characterisation methods. Assist Engineer in performing DoEs to drive process optimisation and continuous improvement efforts, including consolidating and summarising of data for review. Be responsible for process control checks, quality, from traceability to test and characterisation. Any other adhoc duties as and when assigned by superior. Ability to work sensitively, discretely, and effectively across Dyson. Practical experience with strong sense of health, safety and environmental responsibilities and requirements within a chemical environment. Strong problem-solving skills exemplified by the ability to diagnose and rectify problem. Good organisational and time management skills. Good written and verbal communication. Ability to work independently as well as in a group effectively, including flexibility and adaptability working with cross-functional teams. Able to work in cleanroom environment; wearing jumpsuits, and safety shoes. A self-motivated team player with can-do attitude. Must demonstrate a passion for working for Dyson. Desirable: Appreciation of relevant Battery technology or battery products across the industry. Willing to work in a start-up environment. Our client is a leading trading house looking to expand its market research capabilities with an experienced and self-motivated Research Analyst. See job description for details The Lead Architect is responsible for creating the most appropriate architecture and providing technical leadership in complex project(s) independently. Key Responsibilities: Project Delivery Provide technical leadership in complex project(s) independently. Define system-level application architecture that includes high-level design, architectural policies and principles, design and programming guidelines, implementation risks and mitigation measures, software development and integration strategies, software configuration controls, etc. Maintain control over the architecture throughout the entire software development lifecycle by continuously making critical adjustments to the architecture to ensure desired results are achieved. Involve in requirement analysis phase to ensure the implementation feasibility of functional specifications. Provide technical leadership in the project through established design and development methodologies, to ensure system meets functional and system requirements. Engage customers to explain the rationale of architecture's selection, or other technical issues. Ensure best practices, frameworks and re-useable components are employed in the project. Trouble-shoot technical problems faced by the project team. Organisation Development Coach, train and mentor Associate Architects and Architects. Share technology knowledge with the rest of organisation through Community of Practice (CoPs) or other in-house forums. Package and conduct in-depth technical courses. Contribute to knowledge repository on experience learnt through project implementation. Business Development Be involved in pre-sales solution activities to review technical solution and estimated effort prepared by proposal team. Help NCS to win mindshare to be speaker or panellist in IT-related trade show or seminar. The ideal candidate should be / possess: Typically 8 years' experience in technical role with responsibilities that apply in-depth knowledge of architectural principles and design. Experience in developing and deploying complex scalable production applications on Cloud/PaaS platforms and Containers. Working knowledge of DevOps software development tools and methodologies. Broad and deep knowledge in current IT technologies. Proficiency in Java-related technology specification and standards. Certification in appropriate technologies is an advantage. Self-motivated with a positive "can-do" attitude, creative with excellent presentation, communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills including strong persuasive techniques. Ability to lead, develop and maintain respectful and trusting relationship. Proficient in written and spoken English. Degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering / Information Technology related field, or IT equivalent. Able to travel as required.

Product Analyst About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Assemble Assemble is a web-based platform that enables creation of solutions (products) for the bank's Risk, Finance and Compliance Departments. As a platform, the ambition is to improve speed-to-market on solutions for our diverse stakeholders through smart design and build out of innovative, reusable and stackable plug-n-play features with room for bespoke changes. We are currently looking for a Business Analyst / Product Analyst to help with build out of a pre-deal workflow solution to support Reputational and Sustainability Risk (RSR) . Also, and with equal importance, contribute innovative ideas and follow-through with build-up of Assemble's growing suite of stackable apps/features. The Role Responsibilities As a Business Analyst, you will: Participate in / facilitate User Discovery sessions by partnering with our Designers to understand the why, what and whom of a given business problem Write up high-level story maps and convert these into user stories Run workshops with Squad to detail user stories with Acceptance Criteria and break them down into smaller Tasks Work with / back up Product Owner and Scrum Master to ensure a predictable cadence of delivery Contribute to scoping MVPs/Releases through Planning sessions with Product Owner, Scrum Master and Squad and determine measurable business outcomes In partnership with a dedicated testing team, ensure that all deliveries are fit-for-purpose and address business outcomes Train and support business users through the product lifecycle Ensure that knowledge is shared throughout the BA team so that team members can support each other and maintain continuity throughout the project Continually challenge the status-quo (both solutions and process) Our Candidate Preferred General knowledge / intuition of banking and the relevance of Risk, Finance and Compliance within a bank Prior experience working as a Business Analyst (1+ years) or Product Manager (1+ year) or as a Developer / Analyst (1+ years) Prior experience working in an Agile product / software delivery environment (any methodology) Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential for this role Experience with JIRA, Confluence, SQL Curious by nature and proactive in resolving issues/challenges Good to Have Experience working in any one domain: Market Risk, Credit Risk, Operational Risk, Finance or Compliance AND/OR - A recognised qualification/certificate like FRM/PRM or Accredited Certificate courses through established MOOCs e.g. Coursera Could Have Understands or has worked on Domain-driven Design and Microservices Value Stream Mapping TDD / Automated software testing User Experience Design and Tools like Figma, InVision Facilitated workshops and/or exposure to group-facilitation tools like MIRO, MURAL Familiar with Agile Product Management principles and metrics Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. About us Dyson began twenty one years ago with James Dyson and a handful of engineers questioning everyday products, thinking differently and making them better. We are now the world's number one vacuum cleaner manufacturer in the UK, US, Japan, Europe and Australasia.We've even branched out to improving commercial technology that frustrates us. The Dyson Airblade hand dryer dries hands in ten seconds, it’s also the most hygienic and energy efficient hand dryer available. And more recently a fan, Air Multiplier, with no blades or grille.About the role Responsible to apply measurement techniques to prepare, conduct and evaluate parts and assemblies for implementation at the early stages of product development. This is an In-Laboratory position, and this role is responsible to assist the RDD team by improving and solving problems in regards to design and manufacturing issues during the early stage of product development. Primary responsibilities: Actively support engineering in carrying out measurement tasks and plans on various measurement machines (CMM, Smartscope, Tensile machine, Roundness tester, Surface profiler/ roughness tester and any other precision measurement tools), including set up, running the measurement and generating the measurement report. Ensure measurements have good accuracy and repeatability. Manage the calibration of machines and tools, including planning and coordinating of preventive maintenance and calibration of machines with external service providers. Create, prepare and standardize inspection/measurement reports. Receive moderate level of guidance and supervision (25%), work toward assigned plans and executes their own work to the highest standards and in timely fashion. Secondary responsibilities Evaluate and implement solutions to problems related to metrology & measurement systems discipline – Inspections, Analysis, Testing, Documentation. Work from written or verbal instructions, detailed attention to engineering drawings, and 3D models to establish inspection criteria and measurement implementation, proactively offering practical ideas and solutions. Coordinate continuous improvement plans with respect to metrology activities. Coordinate with external parties for services and purchases; including commissioning, installations, upgrades and outsource jobs. Basic working experience in advanced and prototype engineering will be added advantage. Basic knowledge of reading engineering drawings. Intermediate knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint). Basic knowledge of 3D CAD modelling and GD&T. Familiar with plastic / metal part design and manufacturing processes. Basic knowledge of jigs and fixtures for measurements. Basic organizational and planning skills. Basic Digital Radiography Technical Qualification Minimum 1- 2 years of working experiences in Metrology laboratory (Preferable). Basic working knowledge of core discipline Basic knowledge of CMM, measurement hand tools, fixturing and smartscope operation. Good time management skills on individual tasks and when coordinating work with other. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English. Ability to gather information & problem solve with a systematic, logical approach. This will often be for issues with no pre-precedent. Expected to be able to resolve problems effectively while managing stakeholders’ expectations. Ability to provide independent opinions/viewpoints to a problem with sound evidence and assess multiple opinions/viewpoints independently, recognising evidence & able to determine technical direction in specialist areas. Associate, Full Stack Web Engineer Description About this role About this r ole Elevate your career by making a difference in the world's largest asset manager! Flourish in an environment that fosters positive relationships , inclusive and recognizes outstanding performance! We know you want to feel valued every single day and be recognized for your contribution. At BlackRock, we strive to empower our employees and effectively engage your involvement in our success. Th e role is within Client Trading development team whose mandate is delivering of BlackRock's industry-leading liquidity management platform powered by Aladdin® . We are beginning a multi-year project to rearchitect and redesign our platform to fuel dramatic growth in assets under management and volume. We are passionate about building high-quality software that is intuitive and efficient to use, visually appealing and encourages end-user delight. What makes us special as a company Our purpose is meaningful: to help more and more people experience financial well-being, allowing them to have better health, education, and retirement. As the biggest asset manager, we are among the top companies globally and have a highly secure and established financial pedigree. BlackRock is socially responsible employees have two fully paid volunteering days a year! We are a FinTech company with equal emphasis on Technology and Finance Employees can take unlimited holiday above the legally eligible limit. We give additional holidays to new parents! Compared to many big companies, employees enjoy more freedom to provide input and express their opinion. What makes us special as a team We build solutions for both BlackRock and over 100 organizations who get an advantage by using our Aladdin® eco-system. We deliver complete end-to-end solutions as a global Agile Team consisting of Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Business Analysts, Engineers, UX/UI designers, and Test Automation engineers . We are located across the world team presence at Atlanta, Budapest, India, London , and Singapore . We are passionate about our profession. We keep learning and sharing our knowledge internally and externally. We are developing in Angular, React, Java, Python, Cassandra, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, a whole host of languages and many other open-source technologies. For the right people this is the opportunity to excel.

Job Category Sales Job Details The Strategic Client Architect (SCA) is a customer-facing role to guide our most strategic customers and prospects on their digital transformation journeys as they respond to the challenges and opportunities of the 4th Industrial Revolution. Working along-side senior sales leaders, accounts teams and marketing functions, you will be required to help customers translate their business strategy into a technology vision and roadmap to deliver realisable business outcomes leveraging both the MuleSoft and Salesforce platforms. This will require a level of business acumen, an ability to advise customers on technology solutions with a primary focus on customer and employee experience. This role requires previous Enterprise Architecture experience to bring together a broad vision for our customers, as well as define an architecture strategy and roadmap for their adoption of MuleSoft/Salesforce. This position requires a senior individual with a strong blend of digital transformation, business, enterprise architecture and consultative skills. It is an expectation of the role that this individual will be able to build meaningful connections with senior executives and key decision makers. Key Responsibilities Strategic Advisor - You will be aligned to a set of strategic accounts, where you will co-create the Account strategy and own the technology vision and strategy. Become a trusted advisor to CIO/CTO/EA level contacts and their teams as they look to transform their business Knowledge and ability to articulate key concepts in digital transformation, customer and employee experience and the application of emerging technologies. Lead specific enterprise architecture engagements in key accounts. Understand the customer’s business strategy and technology needs; identifying account whitespace, the key capabilities and technology enablers required and linking these to business outcomes Be accountable for the development of business case documents, visioning proposals, enterprise architecture artefacts, solution roadmaps and executive presentations. Work within a matrix-style organisation, collaborating across multiple teams and stakeholders. Mentor and guide sales, pre-sales and customer resources on strategic opportunities. Participation in the delivery of solution best practices, Industry reference architectures and educational sessions to existing customers, partners and to internal audiences. Required Experience/Skills Proven experience in creating, selling or implementing technology-based solutions Ability to identify and communicate the business value of technology decisions Key experience in Digital Transformation, Strategy development Multi-year experience in either a software vendor or enterprise architecture disciplines Excellent experience in the principles of cloud based platforms and their place in an organisations IT strategy and enterprise architecture. Desired Skills Familiarity with solution selling or equivalent Sales Methodologies Deep experience working in one or more industries Familiarity with modern Digital Operating Models and Transformation programs Experience of architectural frameworks, principles and tools Familiarity with design thinking and or similar frameworks Familiarity with relevant industry (regional, vertical,) data privacy, security and compliance requirements for Cloud Knowledge of Iaas Providers (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Microsoft Azure, Alibaba, etc) About MuleSoft, a Salesforce company Our mission is to help organizations change and innovate faster by making it easy to connect the world’s applications, data, and devices. Companies like Spotify, McDonald’s, and Unilever rely on MuleSoft to stay agile, deliver faster, and make the most of their IT investment with API-led connectivity. Hiring exceptional people who want to build a great company together is our number one priority, and we’re committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace where everyone is supported and inspired to do their best work. Description Major Bank Change the HR Game with Data Design and Implement Advanced Tools and Dashboards Our client is a highly successful and well-regarded major bank with strong presence in the region. With significant investments into technology and innovation to support its strategic transformation including its human resources function, there is now an exciting opportunity to be part of the People Analytics team driving the future of data-driven HR analysis and decisioning in the bank. Responsibilities This is an exciting role reporting to the Head of People Analytics, where you will design and implement self-service dashboards with intuitive user experience that presents data insights in a meaningful and actionable manner for key HR stakeholders, including the CHRO. You will partner closely with HR stakeholders to understand business problems, identify analytics use cases and translate business issues into hypotheses and problem statements for analytics. You will also support the design and implementation of a HR data governance framework. This is a visible role where you will act as an internal consultant on people data and analytics and evangelise its adoption. Requirements You are a degree qualified with demonstrated track record in advanced analytics experience gained in large complex organisations or consulting firms. You have strong data visualization skills with hands on experience in organizing KPIs and building BI dashboards (e.g. Prism, Power BI, Qliksense, Tableau), good understanding of database joins concepts, and knowledge and technical expertise in data analysis technologies (e.g. R, Python, SAS).  You are passionate about numbers, inquisitive and commercial, with strong analytical and communication skills. Candidates with strong analytics experience outside of the People function can also be considered. Wood is currently recruiting for Electronics Technicians with extensive operations and maintenance experience in the oil and gas industry, Job Objective We are supporting the development of an offshore field to support bringing gas to the market by 2022. The development of the fields shall be undertaken using a new-build, spread-moored gas FPSO unit to process gas and associated liquids from subsea wells.  Dry pipeline spec gas will be produced and piped through a gas export line to an onshore facility while the recoverable liquids will be tandem offloaded into tankers from the FPSO.  The final subsea infrastructure will include three development wells. The project will support with the preparation, start up and subsequent operation and maintenance of the deepwater gas development. The position will initially be based in Singapore with ad hoc travel or rotational to East Mediterranean until early 2022.. The Electronics Technician will perform the required inspection, maintenance and repairs of the Variable Frequency Drives (VFD’s) and Marine related electrical/electronic systems associated with FPSO operations to meet the planning, scheduling and priorities of the FPSO whilst ensuring work is performed effectively, efficiently and safely and in accordance with the required procedures. Key Accountabilities Yard Phase Reporting to on shift Maintenance Team Lead Responsible for the safe and reliable operation of VFD’s and Marine electrical/electronic equipment. Ensures the installation, calibration and testing of VFD’s and Marine electrical/electronic equipment is conducted in accordance with company requirements and any statutory guidelines. Carry out system walk downs, punch listing and handover responsibilities. Embedding Company values and culture into the team and identifying any areas that are deficient so that alterations and improvements can be made. Ensures the required supply of spare parts is available, prepares and requisitions items required. Assessment of the VFD’s and Marine electrical/electronic systems to ensure operability will be acceptable with any deficiencies identified in a timely manner to enable resolution or mitigation and where appropriate the risks of not addressing are fully understood Put forward suggestions and develop modification requests as necessary to improve plant/equipment efficiency/safety operations Maintaining all Marine electrical/electronic equipment and systems controlling and supporting the FPSO Process and Utility systems, Fire protection / extinguishing and appropriate Electrical Emergency Shutdown systems in a safe and competent manner Review of the operational manuals and procedures and ensure the onsite walk through and dry runs ensure that they are fit for purpose and accurate. Participation in risk assessments when appropriate Assist other discipline teams where required. Proactively contribute to delivery against HSE plans and improvement objectives. Be aware of physical condition of plant & equipment to ensure technical integrity is maintained; raise issues and concerns identified. Ensure a safe and comprehensive handover is given at shift or crew change with all pertinent operational and maintenance information to relevant personnel. VFD’s and Marine electrical/electronic equipment to be inspected on installation and equipment identified correctly .Each location to have a detailed checklist of equipment available and maintenance schedule in place. Final inventory checks to be completed prior to sail away. Support for the transition to Energean safe systems of work at sailaway to ensure that Company duty of care is fulfilled. Working within the statutory Health and Safety Procedures and the Permit-to-Work system Implementing planned and corrective maintenance on all Marine electrical/electronic equipment Sound knowledge of plant operation, maintenance and computerised maintenance systems Responsible for correctly completing paperwork / checklists such as equipment description, principles, rating ranges, test records and inspections Participate in PTW training for assurance that all personnel are competent with system requirements. Operations Report any defect or inspection report to relevant Asset Supervisor in a clear and concise manner and record all relevant information in logs as required. Actively participate in meetings, planning, initiatives etc. Safety related equipment is supplied and installed correctly with any deficiencies identified as early as possible to allow timely rectification. Maintain complete and accurate records within the Maintenance Management System Adhere to all legislative, environmental and company standards and procedures and checklists. Ensure critical spares are available and any discrepancies are addressed Ensures the required supply of spare parts is available, prepares and requisitions items required. Maintains good housekeeping conditions in workshop and work sites Ensure effective systems are maintained for the identification, assessment and control of significant environmental risks at site. Responsible for weekly monitoring checks on safety and production critical equipment, reporting any deviation of set parameters and raise work orders in client’s maintenance management system. Maintain effective communication with Supervisors and other work groups. Carry out major services, overhauls, intrusive maintenance, fault finding and diagnostic checks on VFD’s and Marine electrical/electronic equipment ensuring any repairs are addressed promptly. Provide technical instruction and guidance to ad hoc personnel and new team members Participate in HSEQ activities to make sure that risks are understood and controlled to highest level possible. Participate and actively encourage a ONE TEAM approach for the O&M crew and the third party contractors staff that will be part of the core team make up. Responding to out of hours call-outs as requested Be part of the Emergency Response Team Participating in incident investigations as required Performance Indicators (Indicative) Agree personal HSE development plans and goals. Competency profile attainment against discipline plan. Effective delivery of assigned work scopes in accordance with process, procedure and plans. Effective performance reports delivered in a timely manner. Actively maintaining own competence and continuous development Work executed safely in accordance with delivery plans. Communications & Working Relationships Internal: Establish and maintain effective working relationships and communicate across the project/ contract interfaces. Effective 2-way communicator, comfortable with presenting, able to build strong working relationships with peers. Community development including: Networking /Knowledge sharing. External: Effective 2-way communicator, comfortable in both Client and other 3rd party environments; able to build exemplary working relationship with Client and other Stakeholders Level of Influence & Decision Making Authority As delegated by line management. Good communication skills, be flexible and have a willingness to make a difference. Management of change (Technical) Skills / Qualifications Qualification Minimum Qualifications: Completed recognized Electrical Apprenticeship. SVQ3 – Electrical Maintenance and Systems. Current COMPEX certification. BOSIET / MEDICAL / MIST training Emergency Response Team Job-Specific Skills: Previous offshore oil and gas experience, preferably working on an FPSO Experienced and knowledgeable in the of VSD’s (Variable Speed Drives) Experience in topsides and marine electrical systems. Power Generation, Turbines, UPS Systems, HV/LV switchgear, networks and power management, Motors, Lighting and VAV Aids. Demonstrable knowledge of Electrical & Control Systems Experience of working within the strict limitations of a Permit to Work system Good communication, team working and coaching skills. Demonstrable knowledge of Maintenance Process practices Able to read and work from engineering/vendor drawings Knowledge of hazardous area classification is required. HV / MV / LV Switching and Protection systems Company Overview Wood is a global leader in engineering and consultancy across energy and the built environment, helping to unlock solutions to some of the world’s most critical challenges. Job Description Purpose The purpose of this role is to develop, initiate, and implement compliance programs and best practices for the De Beers Diamond Trading Group and ensure compliance with external regulators. This is a varied, unconventional, and challenging role which will require the ability to engage various levels of stakeholders amongst external stakeholders (Government, private sector, De Beers Group, Anglo American Group (UK, South Africa, Singapore, Hong Kong, Israel, Antwerp, India, and Botswana), Diamond Industry across the upstream, downstream and midstream, general public etc.)   The role will need to deliver in a dynamic and unconventional environment. The role requires excellent relationship management, decision making skills, project co-ordination, research and analytical skills, attention to detail, excellent communication and written skills, and good IT skills. The incumbent needs to be an organised individual who enjoys an extremely dynamic, and varied role. Key Responsibilities/Activities Customer Registration Manage process to register Buyers, Seller & Traders, screening customers and validating completeness and accuracy of all documentation. Define and execute registration process for 3rd party suppliers and other significant 3rd parties. Flag any Best Practice Principles and Anti-Money Laundering issues to Line Manager, recommend and action approved solutions. Set up successfully registered customers in Sales Force, website and other relevant systems. Issue customer de-registration communications and oversees de-registration for dormant accounts. Job_Descriptions: Team Head, Business Support - AIMS (Associate Director / Director) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels.
