Start your career with Bank of Singapore as a Team Head, Business Support! ! Dedicated business support resource to augment the management capacity & client-facing time of the Department Head and the Team Leads in AIMS and to provide focused management of the AIMS support team. The role will develop and maintain frameworks, minimum standards and a consistent approach to management of topics such as business analytics, pipeline management and policy/procedure maintenance. The role would also aggregate needs for system tools and be the senior business rep for AIMS on key projects. The focus will be on business management including financial analysis, operating plan, strategic projects, administrative functions, financial and other management support activities for the AIMS business. The role requires a solid understanding of the Asset management business ideally with experience gained in either or both the Mutual Fund and the Alternative asset management businesses, strong interpersonal and communication skills, ability to collaborate and influence to achieve objectives and deliver practical results. An interest and experience analyzing and interpreting data using tools such as Tableau, Qlikview or Power BI would be a distinct advantage. Mandate: SME for all underlying business processes within AIMS Primary point of contact & coordination between AIMS and the key partners within the organization for all business & change management activities Central management & oversight of business strategies, plans, performance/cost management initiatives and management reporting Central production of Management Information Effective oversight of governance & control issues to drive proper behavior in the Advisory & Sales processes i.e Cross-border business, Investment & Product Suitability, Order Taking Standards & Pricing, Audits & Inspections Key Roles and Responsibilities: Support change management initiatives by representing AIMS at various working groups and forums. Work with key stakeholders to ensure process changes and solutions are sustainable and obtain buy-in from the AIMS leadership. Operate as a conduit for AIMS in streamlining businesses processes by escalating gaps & inefficiencies to the technology teams and application owners. Initiate tactical improvements to existing practices where required. Manage the repository of AIMS business process documentation Monitor sales performance, keep abreast of the market trends, the competition and be prepared to instigate initiatives & business reviews to keep traction with financial targets Conduct financial planning and sales management for PMG including tracking of expenses, hires, recruitment, KPI, product performance etc. Secretariat for selected management meetings and responsible for managing the tracking and closure of deliverables Support senior management with ad hoc presentations for key meetings such as sales forum, off sites etc. Ensure compliance with Group Policies and Standards by driving a regular review of the Control results with the Department Manager & Team Leads and propose corrective actions where required - Tone from the Top risk culture Manage internal or external audits, inspections, training and ad-hoc administrative Qualifications Bachelor's degree level qualification. Candidates from other backgrounds, but with work experience in related fields may be considered. Solid demonstrable experience in working directly with Senior Management in a business management, risk and governance and change management (including technology) capacity within Private Banking. Knowledge of the Asset management industry ideally with experience gained in either or both the Mutual Fund and the Alternative asset management businesses Proven track record of project-managing and delivering cross-functional projects on time with minimal impact on users Strong knowledge and understanding of Front Office controls, risk policies, procedures and requirements in the context of both the Singapore and Hong Kong regulations Meticulous, focused and a demonstrated ability to work independently under time pressure, from start to finish Strong organizational skills and ability to work as an integral part of a larger team, over multiple, concurrent projects, across a variety of topics Highly energetic and affirmative, with a positive, influential style even in the face of challenging circumstances Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficient in MS Office Suite and other tools (specifically MS Excel and PowerPoint)

Job_Title: Head of Learning and Talent Development, Global Investment Firm
Job_Descriptions: Head of Learning and Talent Development, Global Investment Management Firm Head of Learning and Talent Development, Global Investment Management Firm Our client is a global Investment Management Firm headquartered in the US with over 150 employees globally. Owing to continued growth and commitment in the Asia region, the need has arisen to recruit a top tier Talent professional to develop and run their Learning & Development framework. Reporting to the Chief People Officer, this role will primarily be responsible for designing, building, and rolling out a global learning framework. You will evaluate organizational learning needs, and working with vendors, will create an exceptional employee experience, from onboarding through to technical training and talent development programmes. You will be responsible for measuring and reporting on these learning programs and their effectiveness, and the aim will be to deliver high-impact programs across multiple geographies. The role has the potential to expand further into Talent Development, HiPo planning, Coaching and Leadership Development. You need to be a self-starter and happy to be hands on, working to drive an impact and build a culture through consensus and collaboration. This role will suit someone who has a passion to design and develop but more importantly is also solutions focused and highly organised and detail orientated. The successful candidate will be degree educated with a minimum of 8+ years' experience in Learning including program design and delivery and will preferably have experience with Financial Services or specifically boutique Investment firms, fintech or smaller environments. Applicants from all industries are welcome but those with exposure to fast paced and best in class organisations will be preferred. Importantly you will have built or at least fundamentally shaped learning functions and frameworks and will have had the autonomy to make decisions independently. Job_Title: Global Markets Operations, FICC Ops, IRP Operations, Analyst/Associate, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Global Markets Operations, FICC Ops, IRP Operations, Analyst/Associate, Singapore OPERATIONS Operations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the firm to provide banking, securities, and asset management services to clients around the world. In addition, Operations provides essential risk management and controls to preserve and enhance the firm's assets and its reputation. For every new product launched and every trade executed, it is Operations that develops and manages the processes and controls that enable business flow. YOUR IMPACT Are you looking to for an opportunity to be part of a team that works directly with institutional clients, sales & trading desks, technology and other business partners to offer best in class client service, solve complex problems and influence change? This is a great opportunity for an analytical/client service individual to utilize their professional skills by controlling risks and driving efficiencies in a fast paced environment. OUR IMPACT Operations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the firm to deliver banking, sales and trading, and asset management capabilities to clients around the world. In addition, Operations provides essential risk management and control to preserve and enhance the firm's assets and its reputation. For every trade agreed, every new product launched or market entered, every transaction completed, it is Operations that develops the processes and controls that makes business flow. Within Securities Divisional Operations, the Interest Rate Product Sales and Trading Services team provides risk management by facilitating the intraday processing and exception management of trade breaks both internally and externally for IRP products. Various operational reconciliations are performed on trade date and post trade date to ensure successful trade flow and books and records balancing. The team also executes various projects aimed at balance sheet optimization and gaining operational efficiency. The team works closely with team members across regional and global offices to facilitate the above functions. The team supports a cross section of products ranging from highly complex structured transactions to more vanilla trades. Individuals are required to develop a strong product, industry, and technical knowledge in order to facilitate the transaction flow and to anticipate and avoid potential trade problems. This position requires a high degree of communication with traders and salespeople in a fast paced setting and ongoing interaction with other Operations teams, Compliance, Credit, and Technology to resolve issues arising from trade execution, client queries, and new business. In addition, we are looking for a strong candidate that can help to drive workflow improvement across the organization. HOW YOU WILL FULFILL YOUR POTENTIAL • Work with Client, Sales/Trading desks and other stakeholders to resolve any open questions/issues • Become a subject matter expert to mitigate risk and drive efficiencies • Manage real-time trade booking exceptions internally between the trading desk and sales force • Monitor and control operational risk throughout the trade processing life cycle • Collaborate with our technology and business partners to enhance systems and workflows • Engage in various industry and regulatory initiatives in a constantly changing environment • Collaborate with technology teams on the implementation of process flow improvements and efficiencies SKILLS & EXPERIENCE WE'RE LOOKING FOR Basic Qualifications • Bachelor's degree • Proactive, enthusiastic, and creative approach with very high attention to detail • Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment • Highly collaborative and team-focused with ability to interact effectively with a wide range of individuals • Effective problem solving and critical thinking skills along with the ability to use discretion and good judgment Preferred Qualifications • At least 2-5 years of work experience in Finance or related field • Competency with MS Suite, especially Excel, and the ability to learn multiple programs quickly

Job_Title: Strategic Pricing Analyst, Travel Retail APAC
Job_Descriptions: POSITION SUMMARY Support the Pricing Director in conducting regular and ad-hoc strategic pricing analyses for Travel Retail World Wide to identify pricing-related opportunities for growth. Support the roll out of key strategic pricing tools, approach and framework to be used by the broader set of key functional stakeholders (e.g., finance, commercial, demand planning) in NY, Lachen and the three TRWW Regions. Responsibilities Gather key input data, perform data clean up and conduct strategic pricing analyses with the guidance from strategic pricing director Price Change Diagnosis: evaluate whether a downturn of business performance is a result of suboptimal pricing decisions (i.e., versus the other “4P” levers) TR price architecture review: evaluate whether TR hero SKUs are priced within reasonable range vs. competitive benchmark SKUs Corridor Pricing: conduct scenario modelling based on changes to reference market and/or percentage savings; size investments required and potential upside (elasticity coefficient) Travel Retail Exclusives (TREX) SRPs: provide input to setting SRP for TREX newness, most notably for new product offerings for which value is not the primary differentiator (e.g., gift sets) Key shopping moment pricing review: lead the pricing and promo analysis for key shopping moment in China such as D11, Women’s Day, 618 by collaborating with the China, IM, and Insights Team Elasticity and Promotion analysis: analyse volume uplift for key SKUs against key targeted nationalities, both on a temporary and permanent basis; develop guidelines around promotional length, depth and (sub) categories, including SPOs Evaluate Effectiveness of other consumer incentives such as GwPs and deluxe samples Support the system and tools lead and in development and roll out of various pricing tools in the region by the broader TRWW team (e.g., replacement of pricing console, Strategic Pricing Tool for corridor monitoring and sensitivity analysis, SPO tools for tracking and evaluating SPOs) Support orientation for new hire / new team member in the group as needed Qualifications KEY REQUIREMENTS Degree in Finance, Business or other quantitative field with a minimum of 3 years’ relevant analytics experience Strong analytical, communication and organizational skills Able to follow analytical approach and drive insights Strong attention to detail Strong excel and power point skills High Proficiency in English and Chinese languages Knowledge of advanced data visualization platform and / or data science tools is a big plus Job: Finance & Accounting Primary Location: Asia Pacific-SG- Job Type: Standard Schedule: Full-time Shift: 1st (Day) Shift Job Number: 2122729

Credit Risk Quant Credit Risk Quant Singapore As a Barclays Credit Risk Quant, you will be part of a team responsible for understanding the risks inherent in our bank's portfolio of derivatives and financing trades. You will ensure counterparty risk is measured and reported accurately while challenging the Front Office in our role as second line of defense. As part of a wider global team, you will work with counterparts in London and New York to develop best practice risk management approaches and maintain consistency across all regions. Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? Tracking trends and news in the markets, linking events to our portfolio, guiding the production of reports and presenting findings to senior leaders and risk management Shaping the team's strategy for monitoring and managing the portfolio Helping to form the bank's control environment in line with our objectives while driving the creation of new risk frameworks and limits Leading discussions with the business on their direction of travel and ensuring trajectory is in line with our bank's risk appetite Acting as key contact point within Counterparty Risk for regulatory queries and present our bank's approach to local and international regulators where necessary Considering whether the existing systems will capture risk on trades Explaining the risk drivers on such to colleagues within Risk Identifying the key structural risks in exotic trades, for example structural subordination or liquidity risk What we're looking for: Carrying out all duties in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal Barclays Policies and Policy Standards Extensive experience in Credit Risk, specifically in the areas of fundamental credit analysis, derivatives, and counterparty credit risk Undergraduate degree in Maths, Physics, Computer Science, or closely related discipline Proficient in stochastic processes and derivatives pricing. Experience in C++, R, Python or similar and fluency in Excel Skills that will help you in the role: Fluent in written and spoken English Masters or PhD in a technical discipline Ability to motivate and lead a team Familiar with financial statements (Balance Sheet etc) and financial instruments (e.g. bonds, equities, convertible bonds, futures and options) Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

Backend Engineer - Digital Bank We're looking for a Backend Engineer to work onsite within our Digital Bank. We're a small, but growing venture, with new and exciting problems to solve. We work in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams. As a Backend Engineer, you'd be able to work on and solve some of the many interesting challenges we are facing, learn new ways of working, and build delightful high-quality products for our customers. Job Description The role will sit in the engineering space and the person will play a key role implementing code across the banking stack, primarily focussed on our microservice based platforms and solutions. Therefore, we are seeking a skilled and experienced professional who has worked in financial organisations and fintechs or start-ups. The role itself is wide ranging and challenging as you will be working with other senior developers and architects to build a market-leading solution. You will be responsible for building and testing backend components, working with the DevOps, UI and data teams as well as integrating with external systems. The successful candidate will need to liaise with business and technology teams to understand requirements and translate these into solutions The Role Responsibility: • Building microservice based solutions using Kotlin/Java, Kafka and Postgres in a container focussed cloud architecture • Working with the software teams to discuss solution designs and testing deliverables. • Troubleshooting and fixing issues. • Collaborating with the design team to solve application faults. Our Ideal Candidate: • Bachelor's degree in Engineering. • 5 years experience in programming skills using Kotlin or Java and Spring, ideally in Financial institutions / Fintech. • Good knowledge of SQL and relational databases • Experience with Kafka or other streaming or messaging systems. Ideally an understanding of event sourcing or CQRS • Experience with integration ie REST, Webservices, Messaging • Experience building backend software for mobile or web applications • Experience with microservice based or distributed solutions • Experience with AWS and Kubernetes or Docker • Experience with testing with unit, contract and integration tests • Experience of working in an Agile environment

Security Testing Lead - Digital Bank We are New! We are Growing! We are a Startup! We are SC Digital Bank! We are looking for strong talent to be working within our brand new Digital Bank. We are a growing venture with new and exciting problems to solve on a daily basis focused on working towards the mission of creating Singapore's Digital Bank. We are well-backed, agile and do focused work within interdisciplinary teams. If this sounds like a place where you want to work - don't hold back! Send through your profile and get connected in with one of our recruiters to find out more on the opportunity at hand. We're looking for an Offensive & Applied Security Testing Lead (OffSec Lead) to work in our Digital Bank office. We're a small, but growing venture, with new and exciting problems to solve. We work in project-based sprints in small, interdisciplinary teams. As the Offensive & Applied Security Testing Lead you'd be able to work on and solve some of the many interesting challenges we are facing, pave new ways of working, and build delightful high-quality products for our customers. Job Description We are building the core cyber security capabilities for our Digital Bank, setting ourselves to build best of bread practices to support a fast paced and innovative lean business. We set the bar high for the security and resilience of our Bank's services, to ensure we are always able to serve our customers and the community. The Offensive & Applied Security Testing Lead will have the unique mission to ensure our systems are robust and secure, and our teams are always at the top of their game in the detection and response to anomalies and unplanned events - but continuously testing them. Our mission: collaboratively improve our ability to detect and remediate vulnerabilities before adversaries exploits them, and our ability to detect and respond to attacks and outages. This is an evolutive role, which involve mature practices such as penetration testing, and more modern and adaptive methods such as Bug Bounties, Red Teaming and Chaos/Resilience engineering. The candidate should have a strong emphasis on working with DevOps and SRE teams on setting the right collaborative culture and ensuring tests are fit-for-purpose, meaningful and source of learning. The Role Responsibility: Our Digital Bank is set for a rapid growth and rapidly evolutive environment, thus the candidate will need to shape and adapt our practices from start-up stage to world-class maturity, continuously maintaining control effectiveness. The role will be set to evolve and grow over time as the company develops. Not exhaustively, the Offensive & Applied Security Testing Leader will own the following outcomes: Design a strong testing methodology to support the innovation, development and operation of our infrastructures and services, automating security testing and intrusion testing as part of CI/CD and periodical activities Manage vendors and engagements with 3rd party vendors providing services such as penetration testing, red teaming exercises and bug bounties, ensuring the quality of their prestation Support the triage of vulnerabilities found to minimize false-positive and assign risk-graded ratings Perform ad-hoc security tests during the development of our applications to ensure security controls are effective and requirements have been properly implemented Work with Application Security, and Engineering to facilitate the end-to-end traceability and auditability of testing, aiming towards continuous assurance Work with SRE and Product teams to validate the resilience and behavioural exploration of the application through (Security) Chaos Engineering and attack simulation Work with the Cyber Defence and DevOps teams to continuously test and improve our detection, response and remediation performance; improve our resilience towards 99,999% to free error budgets for customer-centric innovation Support Threat Intelligence, Risk Quantification and Awareness activities Helps develop shared libraries to be used by developers to facilitate the implementation and testing of their product's security Our Ideal Candidate: Has at least 10 years of relevant technical experience Has demonstrated experience in the security testing of: SaaS-based applications IaaS providers & services (AWS) APIs Cloud-Native platforms (Kubernetes, Service Meshes, Event Streaming) Cloud-based end-user services (O365, Cloud IAM, Device Trust/MDM/MAM) Can develop automation and reporting capabilities, such as SaaS-compliance queries, performance scorecards Has a good knowledge of DevSecOps, Cloud-Native Security and frictionless guardrails Has the hands-on expertise to build and support the operational objectives while the Bank is in its build phase Is experienced in intrusion/penetration testing both as a tester and a vendor manager; and keen to balance technical and management activities Has demonstrated experience running services complying with Singapore's and international standards in offensive security (MAS TRM, ABS AASE, CBEST, ECB TIBER, HKMA C-RAF) and security control testing (OWASP ASVS/MASVS, MITRE ATT&CK). Is ready to introduce novel resilience testing approaches not yet formalised by regulators. Is self-driven, can articulate the risk of missing controls to all levels of executives Understands that not all vulnerabilities are critical, and it is more effective to help users by automating the remediation rather than accumulate a backlog of vulnerabilities Can demonstrate an ability to learn and establish new practices in an environment where priorities compete, and each user's time is critical Has a solid experience in vulnerabilities and advanced attacks relevant for financial services Is collaborative, with a vision of how to work with developers to embed the best practices of security protection while developing better velocity and risk management outcomes Ideally, has experience working in supporting regulated digital payment services such as payment industry & digital banking, or e-commerce services

Job_Title: VP, Test Program Manager(Customer Management, Credit Origination and Compliance]
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities Overall accountable and responsible for delivery of testing services one or more applications and/or projects of Customer Management, Credit Origination and Compliance domain applications Manage and oversee the day-to-day delivery of test services by Bank appointed vendors in the conduct of testing Works with the testing service providers and other UOB stakeholders to review, provide feedback and sign off on the test strategy, test plans and other test service providers’ artefacts for the testing service delivery. Coordinates with the Test Governance team to ensure adoption of testing methods, standards and tools, and to coordinate any health checks or audits. Ensures that any changes to the scope of services are communicated to the respective test service providers and the impact is factored in to the plan. Engages with various UOB stakeholders (including but not limited to, application, security, infrastructure, business), testing service providers to ensure testing services meet the banks’ objectives and demand. Act as the first point of escalation for any issues raised by UOB stakeholders, testing service providers. Quantify, manage, track and report test related statuses, SLA and KPIs, and ensure that defined testing transformation SLA and KPI targets are met for the portfolio accountable. Drive and collaborate with all UOB stakeholders and test service providers to plan all testing related deliveries for the portfolio accountable. Participate and contribute in forums, as required, to drive testing transformation and innovation. Works closely with the Test Engineering Lead to provide inputs around domain specific test engineering requirements and ensure that they are met. Establishes and maintains effective working relationships with the Vendor Test Managers/Test Leads for the respective domains. Engages stakeholder communities to get their feedback on testing service delivery and identify improvement opportunities to be fed back to the Test CoE team. Job Requirements Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s degree in computer engineering or related field. Proven working experience in test delivery or equivalent role with at least 5 to 7 years relevant experience in large and complex organisations preferably in the area of Banking and Finance and at least 3 years’ manager experience in testing. Extensive experience in managing end to end delivery of testing services from multiple vendor test service providers. Proven experience in testing standards, tools, processes & methodologies, frameworks, and various delivery methodologies e.g. Agile, Hybrid Agile and Waterfall, DevOps. Proven, successful track record of managing shared IT service development and/ or IT Testing Services. Demonstrated success in developing highly effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders to deliver collaboration, partnerships and services. Strong domain knowledge on Customer Management, Credit Origination and Compliance. Experience in managing testing one or more areas of these domains will be an advantage. Strong attention to details, excellent analytical and problem solving skills. Experience in managing multiple external testing service providers. Experience in managing multi-cultural, diverse, direct and virtual teams. Experience in various testing tool suites like HP UFT/QTP, Loadrunner/Performance Center/Sitescope, HP ALM / Quality Center, Tosca, Selenium, JIRA etc. Must display a high level of professional judgment, commitment, integrity, and teamwork. Excellent client facing, internal communications, written and verbal communication skills. Testing or quality certifications, PMP certifications, and Test Maturity Model integration (TMMi) Framework awareness will be preferred. Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

This is a fantastic opportunity to drive excellence in an environment that is both empowering and rewarding. You will also work with the business and infrastructure partners to establish appropriate controls for effective Compliance Risk Management. Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? Managing regulatory interactions with regulators and exchanges, by managing inspections, completing risk assessment questionnaires and responding to queries Hosting regular meetings with business heads, supervisors, senior PDS management on compliance risk issues escalation, MI, supervisory topics etc. Conducting verification checks to assess compliance with internal and regulatory and control requirements Working with partners in other compliance groups, including Country Compliance, Central Compliance, Financial Crime, Monitoring & Testing and Surveillance etc. Being the key contact person for regulators and exchanges in APAC Participating in the development and review of business related and compliance owned policies and procedures Reviewing relevant marketing materials and other client facing materials as appropriate Participating in the review of new products What we're looking for: Carrying out all duties in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal Barclays Policies and Policy Standards A university graduate Good understanding of exchange traded products; controls requirements and knowledge of key global and/or APAC regulatory and exchange rules and regulations Strong communication, interpersonal, influencing, mentoring and negotiating skills Skills that will help you in the role: Multi-tasking and prioritisation skills Meticulous with details and strong focus on the bigger picture Pragmatic in problem-solving and adopting a both flexible and consultative working style Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Significant transformation is underway within the Cyber Security Services (CSS), under the overall purview of COO - Trust, Data and Resilience, to rapidly improve the control environment, along with digitization and innovation. The role is to be the Thematic Risk Lead supporting horizontally across all of the CSS domain services. To co-ordinate risk & control returns/ input/ activities centrally including CSS MI reporting and co-ordination of actions for CSS Risk Forum, co-ordination of any risk and control activities/remediation which cut across all of the domains. As of 1st April 2020, this team has been integrated into the wider TDR Risk & Control function. This team will provide governance, oversight and assurance, as well as advocating and imparting lessons and good practice to shape the design and implementation of cyber security controls. In addition, determining whether these controls are operating effectively. Key responsibilities include: Oversee all risk and control activities related to all people, processes and assets within the CSS function. Lead a team of risk and ICS SMEs to drive a multi-year and complex controls transformation agenda. Deliver risk focused, timely and re-performable deep dive reviews following TDR Control methodology. Design and maintain internal processes that allow CSS to dynamically monitor risk and controls. Maintain all ORTF based CSS controls and corresponding CSTs, KCIs and KRIs. Support the delivery of the overall COO TDR Conduct Risk Management plan. Provide timely and accurate risk & control MI to the respective risk forums. Drive compliance with the Bank's risk framework and policies (e.g. ERMF, ORTF and ICS RTF). Support the design, build, and implementation of effective processes and controls to effectively mitigate ICS risks. Support the CSS Function to be 'First to Know' its risks & issues, and to deliver on its commitments. Support stakeholders in defining remediation actions to address identified control weaknesses and issues. Act as the key confidant to the CSS 'Process Owner(s)' responsible for developing, prioritizing and implementing controls Maintain accurate and timely data within EORP and any other agreed repositories for risk & control data and issues. Track issue remediation, check and challenge delivery status and escalate delays. Validate that remediation activities completed by CSS address the risk in the issues (e.g. Audit issues and deep dive findings). Risk Management Support liaison with Group Internal Audit and any third party or regulatory inspections. Adopt an anticipatory approach to risk assessment through stakeholder engagement and monitoring of the external environment. Work with other control assurance teams to drive efficiency, effectiveness and reduce duplication. Support CSS Process owners in the execution of their accountabilities related to: Identification and management of the end to end processes as defined by the Process Universe and associated risks for the activities carried out. Implementing the RCSA to monitor the effectiveness of the controls and standards governing the end to end process. Being accountable to the Group Process Universe Owner, framework and policy owners and implementing the control requirements applicable to the process. Escalating significant risks and issues to the Process Universe Owners, relevant Risk Framework Owners or Policy Owners. Perform review of the control self-assessment outcomes, monthly control testing results and adequacy of the related remediation actions. Provide thought leadership on control design, assessment, testing processes and drive continuous improvement in ORFT and ICS RTF. Execute deep dive reviews and consistent, efficient and meaningful CSTs / KCI tests for CSS processes. Provide robust challenge and escalation to senior management to ensure activities achieve risk reduction. Manage and drive continuous improvement of the CSS control environment through proactive risk management (e.g. technical deep dive and issue validation). Provide good technical input and challenge on assignment to steer team member in producing high quality output which address the risk. Strategic Build effective relationships with leaders to facilitate: Growing trust with clients and regulators by supporting the CSS Function to be 'First to Know' its risks & issues, and to deliver on its commitments; and The provision of timely, expert advice and assurance; Partnerships with other functions to provide professional advice and assurance Work closely with the TDR key strategic initiatives to provide delivery assurance and assessments of key deliverables. People and Talent Provide strong leadership, management and coaching over colleague(s). Provide proactive self-orienting and self-motivating leadership, and work with limited direction. Lead through example and build the appropriate culture and values. Set appropriate tone and expectations, and work in collaboration with risk and control partners. Build the right mix of SME and risk & control skills. Responsible for identifying 'risk' related knowledge gaps across CSS and facilitate the provision of appropriate training to address these gaps. Governance Provide timely and accurate reporting to appropriate committees, most specifically the CSS Risk Forum and TDR NFRC. Ensure appropriate oversight and facilitate resolution of high impact risk and issues. Tracking and reporting of risk assessments (e.g. audits, risk assessments etc) and their outputs to ensure oversight and escalation mechanisms are in place to provide MI on obligations. Work with the CSS Service Lines to identify emerging risks and ensure they are appropriately addressed and subjected to formal governance. Manage and drive continuous improvement of the CSS internal risk profile reporting, issue management processes and supporting tools. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. Lead the Controls service team to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles: The Right Environment. SeaTown Holdings International (SeaTown), based in Singapore, is an investment manager focused on absolute return/alternative strategies. SeaTown manages both open-end (multi-asset and public credit) and closed-end funds (private credit and private capital/equity). SeaTown is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Temasek Holdings. Role & Responsibilities: Legal ‐ Draft, review and negotiate with external counterparts on a variety of commercial agreements, which includes account opening agreements, letter of indemnity, services agreements, broker agreements, trading agreements, custody agreements, administration agreements and marketing agreements. ‐ Transactional support for private equity and credit transactions including review and processing of transaction documents, working with outside counsel on closings, amendments, exits etc. ‐ Provide time‐sensitive support on a wide array of legal inquiries on matters such as operations, customer due diligence (KYC), organizational data, data protection and human resource. ‐ Oversee filing of returns relating to FATCA and CRS regulatory requirements applicable to the local and offshore entities. Corporate Secretarial ‐ Oversee third‐party company secretarial service providers of the entities, ensuring an effective and efficient service is delivered. ‐ Supervise statutory compliance across the entities, local and offshore. ‐ Review resolutions to document transactions, inter alia, account opening, acceptance of facilities, share issues and redemptions and agreements. ‐ Ensure all applicable statutory and regulatory filings are made for the entities in a timely manner, for local and offshore. ‐ Manage counterparties' KYC due diligence requests for information/documents on SeaTown entities in relation to accounts opened or to be opened with such counterparties. ‐ Attend to KYC requests by counterparties for information/documents on SeaTown entities in relation to investments. SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED ‐ Possess a Law degree with 3‐6 years of post qualification legal experience (with a minimum of 2 years general corporate transactional experience), preferably in private practice or with a professional firm. ‐ Preferably with experience of working in the investment management sector, ideally with experience in managing fund entities to ensure compliance with the relevant legislation and respective constitutions. ‐ Preferably with some knowledge of corporate, AML/CFT and data protection laws and regulations in the Cayman Islands and experience in corporate secretarial work. ‐ Have some prior experience in matters relating to key Singapore regulatory requirements such as the Securities & Futures Act, Financial Advisers Act, Personal Data Protection Act and MAS Notices and Guidelines (specifically AML/CFT and outsourcing regulations). ‐ Familiar with FATCA and CRS reporting requirements. ‐ Strong technical and analytical skills with the ability to think broadly on issues, proactive, meticulous, and good in problem solving. ‐ Be a proven team player and able to work well with colleagues, including the finance and operations teams. ‐ Ability to procure and manage the systemization of processes related to KYC, corporate secretarial, document administration and other day‐to‐day processes.

We’re Coinbase. We’re the world’s most trusted way to join the crypto revolution, serving more than 73 million accounts in more than 100 countries. Our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. We’re a group of hard-working overachievers who are deeply focused on building the future of finance and Web 3.0 for our users across the globe, whether they’re trading, storing, staking or using crypto. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us. There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world. Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are: You’ve got good vibes. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow. You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job. You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission. You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. Coinbase is seeking experienced backend engineers to join our team to build out the next generation of crypto-forward products and features. You will solve unique, large scale, highly complex technical problems, bridging the constraints posed by web-scale applications and blockchain technology. You will help build the next generation of systems to make cryptocurrency accessible to everyone across the globe, operating real-time applications with high frequency, low latency updates, and managing the most secure, dockerized infrastructure running in the cloud. What You'll Be Doing Build new services to meet critical product and business needs using Golang. Design scalable systems to solve novel problems with modern cloud technology and industry best practices. Articulate a long term vision for maintaining and scaling our backend systems and the teams running them. Work with engineers, designers, product managers and senior leadership to turn our product and technical vision into a tangible roadmap every quarter. Write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers. What We Look For In You You have at least 5 years of experience in software engineering. You’ve designed, built, scaled and maintained production services, and know how to compose a service oriented architecture. You write high quality, well tested code to meet the needs of your customers. You’re passionate about building an open financial system that brings the world together. Nice To Haves You have gone through a rapid growth in your company (from startup to mid-size). Experience with growth experiments or A/B testing frameworks. You have experience with Blockchain technology (such as Bitcoin, Ethereum etc..) You have experience decomposing a large monolith into microservices. You’ve worked with Golang, Ruby, Docker, Rails, Postgres, MongoDB or DynamoDB. You’ve built financial, high reliability or security systems. Job_Title: Senior Applied Genomics Specialist, South East Asia
Job_Descriptions: Position Summary: The Sr. Sales Specialist (Infectious Disease Testing, Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics) will be responsible for developing and driving sales opportunities by translating deep domain expertise and product knowledge into compelling positioning, competitive and selling strategies. The goal is to promote rapid adoption of lllumina solutions resulting in increased sales success by providing segment and technical knowledge into sales opportunities.  The Specialist will develop key sales opportunities and build a community of satisfied customers by working with district sales personnel, sales channel partners and marketing in both pre- and post-sales activities. This role will focus on driving lllumina's Infectious Disease Testing, Microbial Genomics, and Agrigenomics business in South East Asia to facilitate adoption of lllumina technology across Infectious Disease Testing, Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics, and Environmental Genomics applications. Additional travel outside of region may be occasionally required. Position Responsibilities: Be the subject matter expert for Infectious Disease Testing, Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics, and Environmental Genomics applications and voice of customer to regional management, global product management, marketing and market development Demonstrate a broad knowledge of the market environment including: current and possible future market trends, practices and information affecting the business; industry trends; competition and competitive environment; marketplace strategies and tactics Advise customers on technical aspects such as end-to-end workflows, study design, possible solutions, product positioning and competitor comparisons. Employ creative solutions to overcome barriers Work with district sales teams to impart deep domain knowledge, including discussion of relevant publications and supporting literature with key customers. Have a deep knowledge of Illumina’s products and the value to customers Provide engaging presentations to drive market interest in lllumina technologies Be recognized by the community as a market expert and a valuable addition to discussions and conference programs Attend relevant trade shows and conferences In collaboration with district sales and marketing teams, develop and execute strategic plans for winning new business, expanding market share, and building upon existing programs manifested by a qualified pipeline of opportunities. Identify and interact with key customer types such as Public Health and Infectious Disease Molecular Testing Laboratories, Academic Researches, Plant and Animal Testing Service Providers, Professional Societies, to develop new sales opportunities and facilitate the introduction of Illumina products into new customer groups Make recommendations to sales management on ways to approach the district market with new assays and technologies or ways for customers to develop solutions within target customer base. Regularly communicate updates to management of in-district sales performance, forecast updates, trends and any issues related to their specific product line performance, competitor activities, or other issues emerging in assigned territory. Facilitate and drive the development of localized sales tools and appropriate training for the sales teams and to support Infectious Disease Testing, Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics, and Environmental Genomics business. Be a champion of lllumina's solutions in these markets. Spend a significant amount of time in the field, visiting customers to maintain positive relationships, implement selling strategies, tactics and driving key sales opportunities related to Illumina’s products. Identify and interact with key opinion leaders and key customers in the Infectious Disease Testing, Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics, and Environmental Genomics to develop new sales opportunities and facilitate the introduction of Illumina products into new customer groups Providing strategic and competitive feedback to field marketing Research and identify new market opportunities in Infectious Disease Testing, Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics, and Environmental Genomics in association with sales partners and marketing teams. Work closely with Market development to assess regional markets to determine viability of emerging applications in Infectious Disease Testing, Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics, and Environmental Genomics in South-East Asia Assist, as time permits, with other business development activities Additional Tasks and Responsibilities Be the primary conduit between the customer and Illumina for custom and/or customized product development project (e.g. custom genotyping arrays) Execute strategies and campaigns to target and win large Genotyping opportunities. Identifies, qualifies, shapes, and recommends pursuit of large ($1M+) opportunities. Listed responsibilities are an essential, but not exhaustive list, of the usual duties associated with the position. Changes to individual responsibilities may occur due to business needs. Position Requirements: At least 5 years experience in a related environment Experience in at least one of the in the following fields: Infectious Disease Testing, Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics, and Environmental Genomics required Prior field experience supporting customers in a highly technical field such as Next Generation Sequencing, Array-based Genotyping, molecular diagnostics or molecular testing preferred Recognized deep expertise in Infectious Disease Testing, Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics, and Environmental Genomics methodologies preferred Use of independent judgement in developing methods, techniques or evaluation criteria for obtaining results Excellent time management skills – is able to prioritise workload accordingly Familiarity with the competitive landscape and trends in the Infectious Disease Testing, Microbial Genomics, Agrigenomics, and Environmental Genomics markets Independently works on highly complex problems requiring analysis of multiple variables Excellent demonstrated communication (verbal and written) presentation and training skills Strong negotiation skills and the ability to persuade Demonstrated proactiveness in initiating and accomplishing tasks Proven ability to lead and influence a broad spectrum of constituents (internal stake holders, external shareholders and key opinion leaders in the field) with divergent interests in order to create a defined and focused course of action Network of established customer relationships preferred Experience in reporting basic financial data Ability to travel within district and regionally to carry out primary responsibilities, must be willing to travel up to 50% Business or Sales experience preferred but not essential All listed requirements are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities. Preferred Additional Experience/Education/Skills: M.Sc. or PhD in a Microbiology, Virology, Public Health, Statistical / Population / Molecular Genetics, Molecular Biology degree preferred. Lab–based experience in sequencing library prep methods and sequencing instrumentation preferred Experience with DNA microarray technology and genotyping applications is preferred. Demonstrated superior problem solving and interpersonal skills in a customer facing environment Clear vision of and commitment to providing outstanding customer service Concerns regarding COVID-19 continue as positive cases are experienced in the communities in which we operate. Please be aware that, as a condition of employment, Illumina may require proof of COVID vaccination in accordance with local statutory requirements (subject to limited exceptions) beginning November 1, 2021. Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

Job_Title: AVP/VP, Senior Business Analyst, Private Market Solutions
Job_Descriptions: We are one of the largest investment management organizations in the world, with over 1000 people working together to create long-term value. Technology Group The Technology Group (TG) is a key enabler to keep our business moving forward and is constantly exploiting state-of-the-art information technologies to enhance GIC's ability to be the leading global long-term investment firm. We aim to provide users with empowering and transformational capabilities, and to create an inclusive, innovative and integrated work environment. This is an opportunity to join GIC as an AVP/VP, Senior/Lead Business Analyst (Private Market Solutions). You will be the key contact and technology partner with Investment Services Private Markets Department and provide solutions through effective use of technology. This role will be part of an integrated team that provides technology and data solutions for trade processing activities. Exposure opportunities Build and support systems in trade processing critical to investment execution. Support Business Lead or Product Owner to facilitate and elicit requirements from business stakeholders for the purpose of producing Business Requirements Document (BRD) or User Stories. Lead discussions, analyze & conceptualize IT solutions that meet business requirements. Validate IT solutions with engineering and architecture teams, and ensure specifications are properly understood by rest of project delivery team. Present IT solution to business and IT stakeholders to explain how the solution addresses their business requirements. During project execution phase prepare Functional Specifications Document (FSD), along with delivery of Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM). Support project team during the execution phase of the project for any queries pertaining to the FSD or BRD or User Stories. Where necessary, re-engage business SMEs to revise requirements and/or for the acceptance of alternative solutions, due to design or implementation constraints encountered. Support Quality Assurance team to define the test strategy and approach and provide clarifications to queries during the testing phase, to both the Quality Assurance team and Business Testers during testing phases. Prepare training plans and user manuals; and conduct trainings to users before system launch and provide close support to system users in the adoption of the new system. With strong collaborative mind-set, work across facets of the business across Front, Middle, and Back Office, the extended Technology team in GIC as well as industry peers and partners. Work alongside an experienced team of professionals and contribute. Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or equivalent. At least 2 years' relevant experience in technology business analysis or software development, familiar with business applications in investment/banking industries. Excellent inter-personal and communication skills, with strong ability to manage and align expectations of senior level business stakeholders across different business units to accept solutions proposed by project team. Possesses strong analytical, critical thinking, problem-solving skills and a team player who has growth mindset and confident to work independently. Experience in the documentation of BRD, FSD, use cases, visual modeling and business processes. Experience with ETL process, SQL & API. Experience in Project Management and Agile Methodology skills with strong delivery mindset. Good understanding of financial application, workflow, UI/UX, database design and software engineering best practices.

Job_Title: Head, Risk and Control - Technology Risk Architecture
Job_Descriptions: International l Investment banking with extensive operations in Singapore is looking for an exceptional, experienced, and influential candidate to oversee the governance and implementation of a Technology Risk Architecture. This is a major programme for an experienced C suite level Risk and Control professional A key responsibility is supporting control teams through the delivery of Technology Transformation Risk Management control and design patterns to support in the execution of the Bank's operational and Information risk frameworks. Responsible for providing support, best practice and guidance, as well as 'hands on' support on risk management areas and operating as the interface with senior wider Bank C Suite level stakeholders across all three lines of defence to manage framework and new risk initiatives which need to be adopted. Overall establishment and implementation of a controls standard and design practice to support R&C and T&I stakeholders, covering the complete risk and control lifecycle. Support the delivery of the creation and review of Governance Committee papers Support Global Head Tech Risk in their capacity on any committees owned by Risk and Control. Coach risk managers to upskill on risk and control knowledge. Ensure the provision of ongoing training and development of people and ensure that holders of all critical functions are suitably skilled and qualified for their roles ensuring that they have effective supervision in place to mitigate any risks. Driving SME knowledge across Technology Risk roles within the bank to meet future needs. Requirements 15+ years of relevant experience in either a 1LoD or 2LoD risk management or risk consulting role. Demonstrated experience of operational risk management with experience of engaging and including senior and C-Suite leaders. Technical IT domain and control knowledge is required. A demonstrable IT Auditing background would highly favourable Senior level involvement in the roll out of a risk management framework in a multinational organisation is preferred. Job_Title: Assistant Vice President - Distribution Manager, Documentation - Commercial Banking - (0000GP0O)
Job_Descriptions: Some careers have more impact than others. If you're looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover how valued you'll be. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. Global Trade and Receivables Finance comprises over 4,500 people across more than 60 countries, helping suppliers and buyers with their export and import finance needs. Trade is where HSBC began in 1865, when we financed commerce between Europe, North America and Asia. We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as an Assistant Vice President - Distribution Manager, Documentation. Job_Title: Vice President - Corporate Banking Business Oversight Compliance
Job_Descriptions: Vice President - Corporate Banking Business Oversight Compliance Vice President - Corporate Banking Business Oversight Compliance Singapore As a Barclays Vice President - Corporate Banking Business Oversight Compliance you will build confidence in our bank for today and for the future of finance. You will oversee the day-to-day Business Oversight Compliance (BOC) for the Corporate Banking businesses across APAC including: Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan. We are looking to grow the role where you also have the chance to collaborate closely with other members of the Private Side & Research Compliance team, in APAC, to assist with BOC coverage for Singapore's Private Bank and Investment Banking and Research businesses. Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? You will initially be responsible for BOC compliance matters such as conduct risk and reputational risk for APAC Corporate Banking in Singapore, Hong Kong and Japan, Working with management and Ops Rigour teams to check and challenge embedment of controls by relevant policies and procedures to meet regulatory requirements Highlighting areas of concern relating to APAC Corporate Banking's embedment of the Enterprise Risk Management Framework in relation to conduct risk and reputational risk Delivering the conduct risk agenda and relevant training to the business Checking and challenging APAC Corporate Banking's risk assessments in relation to conduct risk and reputational risk Working with the Cross Border Compliance team to advise on regional cross border issues Working with relevant Country Compliance teams to advise the business on regulatory changes (alongside relevant Country Compliance) Assisting BOC for Singapore Private Bank, APAC Investment Banking and APAC Research What we're looking for: Carrying out duties in full compliance with regulatory requirements, Enterprise Wide Risk Management Framework and internal Barclays' policies and policy standards. University degree or equivalent industry experience Senior stakeholder management with all senior leadership across various countries across APAC Proven expertise and knowledge of Corporate Banking Compliance matters, analysing structured transactions and ensuring identify and investigate compliance issues Skills that will help you in the role: Experience in the legal or compliance departments of an international investment bank or large organisations Understands complex transactions and explains compliance issues clearly and concisely Ability to become familiar with new products and regulatory requirements Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritise and multi-task Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

Job_Title: Investment Banking, Classic, SEA Advisory Team, Analyst/ Associate, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Investment Banking, Classic, SEA Advisory Team, Analyst/ Associate, Singapore The Investment Banking Division Classic Coverage Team is looking for an Associate to be based in Singapore. Our Associates play an important role in developing and strengthening our client relationships, participating on our advisory teams and in structuring and executing a full range of financial transactions. Their responsibilities include creating and analyzing financial models, organizing and preparing client presentations, helping manage transaction processes, and assisting in structuring transactions. They will gain exposure to the firm's businesses and expand their knowledge of the investment banking industry, as they develop key analytical, communications and marketing skills. They organize and prepare presentations, which explain industry trends, assess clients' situations to provide the necessary financial advice, and recommend strategies to meet client goals. From maintaining client communication to helping Goldman Sachs structure client transactions, our Analysts/ Associates are a vital part of Goldman Sachs' banking team's investments. Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree from top Business schools in a financial discipline. Minimum 2 years relevant experience from investment banking or equivalent experience. Experience working within IBD Excellent in English and fluency in another Southeast Asian language will be looked upon favorably to cover ASEAN clients, but not a necessity History of outstanding academic and professional achievement. Strong team orientation and a demonstrated ability to work effectively with team members in multiple groups and regions.

About the company: Crypto.com (CDC) was founded in 2016 on a simple belief: it's a basic human right for everyone to control their money, data and identity. With over 10 million users on its platform today, Crypto.com provides a powerful alternative to traditional financial services, turning its vision of "cryptocurrency in every wallet" into reality, one customer at a time. Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security, privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have CCSS Level 3, ISO27001:2013, ISO 27701:2019, PCI:DSS 3.2.1, Level 1 compliance, and NIST CSF and PF Tier 4 maturity. Crypto.com is headquartered in Singapore with a 3,000+ strong global team. For more information, please visit www.crypto.com. About the Role We are looking to recruit a Finance Manager to support Crypto.com growing business in Singapore. The overall finance team is currently going through an exciting phase of transformation to support Crypto.com's high growth plans. The Finance Manager will be responsible to take ownership of all financial related matters, including the daily, month end tasks/year end close processes, as well be the primary point of contact to the business in South East Asia. This role offers the successful candidate a fantastic opportunity to help build the finance team by focusing on efficient and effective coordination, governance and execution of accurate financial reporting and providing key insights to the business while driving continuous process improvements. Main Requirements and Responsibilities Prepare and file financial statements, GST/VAT and tax returns; ensure all statutory reporting compliance requirements are met for Singapore and/or other APAC entities in a timely manner Co-ordinate with global finance team to complete month end process ensuring all journals are correctly processed, results are validated and accurate in a timely manner Distil complex financial data with clear and practical insight for business leaders and executives Be an effective finance business partner and the primary point of contact to key team members in the APAC business Strengthen internal control framework and finance process efficiencies and make recommendation to drive continuous operational excellence Support strategic financial analysis, including KPI benchmarking across various products line Liaise with external auditors, tax agents, banking partners, corporate secretary to ensure full statutory compliance Strong interaction and collaboration with global finance teams to ensure consistency in approach, tools and methodology Work with manager and finance teams to roll out new processes, initiatives, policies service enhancements Contribute towards other projects as required Requirements Relevant qualification/s with ACCA/CPA/CA Ideally 5+ years all rounded Finance experience with a Big 4 and/or fast paced MNC Background in a fast paced entrepreneurial or startup/technology environments coupled with crypto knowledge is highly advantageous Flexibility and ability to adapt to changing conditions and different culture Ability to craft and deliver clear, coherent, and concise messages to business leaders Detail oriented, analytical, with an ability to multitask in a high growth environment Self starter who is passionate about start-ups and the growth of digital assets Prior experience in Oracle NetSuite system is a definite advantage Benefits We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech. Flat team. Work side by side with the co-founding team Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. The possibilities are limitless and depend on you You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team You will get to have involvement in developing a brand new product from scratch alongside with a talented team

Job_Title: AVP, AML, Suspicious Transaction Reporting Officer, Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance
Job_Descriptions: AVP, AML, Suspicious Transaction Reporting Officer, Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance (GLRC) supports the Bank in all legal, regulatory and compliance matters. The division ensures that the Bank's businesses comply with policies, procedures and relevant laws, rules and regulations issued by Monetary Authority of Singapore and other local regulators. Apart from being a legal advisor on litigation, trademark filings and other legality issues where relevant, GLRC plays an important role as undertakers of the bank-wide regulatory compliance and anti-money laundering initiatives. This includes developing policies and procedures to manage and mitigate risks relating to money laundering and financing of terrorism, as well as monitoring, detection and combating of money laundering and financial crime activities. Key Responsibilities: Investigate all internal escalations on unusual transactions Conduct research through opened/closed source databases Advise business units / business compliance on STR related issues Document investigation findings File Suspicious Transaction Reports (STRs) to the relevant Authorities within stipulated timeline Participate in AML related projects Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: A good university degree with min 4 years of relevant work experience. Ideal candidate should also have background in AML/CFT investigations and financial fraud. Candidate must possess strong attention to details, research, analytical and investigation skills Proficient in writing with strong communication and interpersonal skills. Self-driven with high level of initiative and follow-through skills. Able to work independently as well as in a team. Knowledge in banking products and experience working in a financial institution on AML / KYC/ anti-fraud related projects is an advantage. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Release Engineer (Banking: DevOps, Release Management, Scripting) 1 year contract, Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Amirah Reza Anwar Recruiter View profile & contact You’ll be working for a banking company who is looking for a Release Engineer. This will be a 1 year contract role to be based in Singapore. Key responsibilities A technical, hands-on Release engineer is required for the bank's Financial Markets working in the eTrading team supporting the bank’s FX trading business. This is a multi-disciplinary role, spanning BAU and project work, from a technical and process perspective. Your primary focus will be to support existing toolset and to bring in timely enhancements to the framework. You will work closely with the development, QA and production support teams to manage and continuously improve all aspects of the release/delivery process. With a focus on automation and self-service you will identify areas of improvement and drive solutions through to implementation; across continuous integration, deployment, monitoring and release. Candidate will be responsible in owning/managing test environments. Work closely with QA/Dev/integration testing teams to ensure that deliveries are not impacted. There is a heavy emphasis on transitioning to agile processes / increasing cloud footprint in 2022 along with a higher tempo of deployments as the applications are broken down into smaller components. KEY REQUIREMENT Must-haves 7-10 years experience as Release Engineer/ Release Manager. Hands-on experience with Enterprise level Application Release Management. Release Management approach/tools Environment management exposure Source Control tools – GIT/SVN etc Basic Scripting knowledge – Linux (bash/python), groovy Hands-on work experience or basic exposure with DevOps Tooling – Jenkins, JIRA, CICD pipelines, Artifactory (any of them is fine) etc Infra management/planning Nice-to-haves (a plus) Containerization tools – Kubernetes, Podman, Openshift K8s Cloud – AWS/Azure General Enterprise Technical Aptitude: networks, servers, load balancing, storage, etc Configuration Management – ansible, puppet Knowledge on Oracle Database management Able to problem-solve at a deep level; determine the root cause of issues and design, plan, and deliver long-term strategic solutions This role is open to Singaporean, Singapore PR or EP holder (max 1 month notice period).
